column1: Kalamb is a town with a municipal council in Osmanabad district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Administratively it is part of and headquarters for the Kalamb Tehsil.
Kalamb is located on the right (south) bank of the Manjara River
column2: just west of the Manjara Dam Reservoir. It has an elevation of 647 metres (2

column3: 35713. Males constituted 52.6% of the population and females 47.4%. Kalamb had an average literacy rate of 73.7%
column4: higher than the national average of 64%: male literacy was 78%
column5: and female literacy was 68%. In 2011 in Kalamb
column6: 13.7% of the population was under 6 years of age.
